definition: to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: He was one of the earliest apostles of collectivistic nationalism in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 他是德国最早的集体主义的民族主义的传道者之一。

sentences.english: They share with earlier individualists a fear of collectivism.
sentences.chinese: 他们与早期的个人主义者一样，害怕集体主义。

sentences.english: To develop socialist market economy should adhere to the principles of "new collectivism".
sentences.chinese: 发展社会主义市场经济应坚持“新集体主义”原则。

sentences.english: The principle of subsidiarity is opposed to all forms of collectivism.
sentences.chinese: 辅助性的原则反对任何形式的集体主义。

sentences.english: It is an effective impetus to collectivism education.
sentences.chinese: 爱院爱校教育是集体主义教育的有效着力点。

sentences.english: Actually, it keeps step with the Collectivism in the final aim.
sentences.chinese: 其实它和集体主义在最终服务的目的上是一致的。

definition: nationalism/national self-determination/principle of nationalism, the first of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning parity between China and the great powers)/racism
